intro: Eriosyce taltalensis var. floccosa, commonly known as the Taltal floccose cactus, is a rare and unique plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of white or grayish hairs, which helps protect it from intense sunlight and salt spray. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils along the coastline, where it forms compact, low-growing clumps. Its flowers, when they appear, are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, adding a subtle beauty to its otherwise muted appearance. Due to its limited habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
